jhelp.util.thread
Class ThreadManager

java.lang.Object
  jhelp.util.thread.ThreadManager

public final class ThreadManager
extends java.lang.Object

Thread manager.
It manage a number of maximum thread in same time, it recycles threads that have finished there task to do next task.
It is better than created a new Thread because here the number of thread is control.
If a task as to do now and no thread is free, the task wait for the first free thread is high priority.
It is possible to launch on other task inside a task, that is not a good idea in classical schedulling system (Here no interblocking).
To use implements ThreadedTask, ThreadedSimpleTask or ThreadedVerySimpleTask, then you can do the task as soon as possible with doThread(ThreadedTask, Object), do action in delayed future with delayedThread(ThreadedTask, Object, long) or repeat the task with repeatThread(ThreadedTask, Object, long, long)

Author:
JHelp

Field Detail

THREAD_MANAGER

public static final ThreadManager THREAD_MANAGER
Thread manager unique singleton instance

Method Detail

approximativeNumberOfFreeThread

public int approximativeNumberOfFreeThread()
Give the approximative value of number of free thread.
Because threads are free, and taken at any time, the value can't be accurate, its just an idea of the result

Returns:
Approximative value of number of free thread

cancelTask

public void cancelTask(int id)
Cancel a task.
The cancel is not immediate, it is do as soon as possible

Parameters:
id - Task id to cancel, give by repeatThread(ThreadedTask, Object, long, long)

delayedThread

public <PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS> void delayedThread(ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS> threadedTask,
                                                      PARAMETER parameter,
                                                      long delay)
Do a task in a delayed time.
When task turn comes, the given parameter is given to it, so you can can this method several times with the same instance of task, but different parameter.

Type Parameters:
PARAMETER - Parameter type
RESULT - Result type of the task
PROGRESS - Progression information type of the task
Parameters:
threadedTask - Task to do
parameter - Parameter to give to the task, when its turn comes
delay - Number of milliseconds to wait before do the task

destroy

public void destroy()
Destroy properly the manager.
Don't use it after call the method

doThread

public <PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS> void doThread(ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS> threadedTask,
                                                 PARAMETER parameter)
To a task as soon as possible.

Type Parameters:
PARAMETER - Parameter tpye
RESULT - Result type
PROGRESS - Progression type
Parameters:
threadedTask - Task to do
parameter - Parameter gives to the task when its turn comes

nearFull

public boolean nearFull()
Indicates if thread manager is near full.
Like approximativeNumberOfFreeThread() it can't be total accurate, but it give a good idea

Returns:
true if thread manager is near full

repeatThread

public <PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS> int repeatThread(ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,RESULT,PROGRESS> threadedTask,
                                                    PARAMETER parameter,
                                                    long delay,
                                                    long repeat)
Repeat a task

Type Parameters:
PARAMETER - Parameter type
RESULT - Result type
PROGRESS - Progress type
Parameters:
threadedTask - Task to repeat
parameter - Parameter give to the task at each repeat
delay - Time to wait in millisecond before do the first time
repeat - Time between each repeat in milliseconds
Returns:
Task ID to able cancel it later with cancelTask(int)

restart

public void restart()
Restart the thread manager
